intro: Gutierrezia sarothrae, commonly known as ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer and early fall, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Gutierrezia sarothrae is also known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
